intro: Muscari calandrinianum, commonly known as the Persian grape hyacinth, is a bulbous perennial plant native to the Mediterranean region. It produces dense clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple, resembling grapes, hence its common name. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–20 cm and thrives in well-drained soil in full sun to partial shade. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often used in rock gardens or as a ground cover. Muscari calandrinianum is relatively low maintenance and blooms in early spring.
